data.title: Homes For Sale In Sandersville, GA
data.meta_description: Find 39 Homes For Sale In Sandersville, GA. See house photos, 3D tours, listing details & neighborhood list of Sandersville real estate for sale.
data.text:
The Sandersville real estate market consists primarily of single-family homes, comprising approximately 80% of the housing stock. There are also condos, townhouses, apartments, and a few mobile homes available. The city has a suburban feel, is surrounded by rural areas, and features a mix of residential and commercial development.

Homes in Sandersville vary in age, with a combination of historic and newer properties. Historic homes with character reminiscent of styles that have been popular through the ages, such as antebellum and art deco, are most readily available in the Sandersville Historic District.

This area includes over 100 homes built between 1830 and 1930. If, however, you prefer a newer home, there are several newer master-planned communities with homes for sale built in the past couple of decades.

It's worth noting that homes for sale in Sandersville tend to be more expensive compared to the surrounding areas. The median home price in Sandersville is approximately $207.5K, whereas, in Washington County, the median home price is around $175K.

However, this is due in part to the larger size of homes available for sale in the city. Sandersville homes for sale tend to be between three and four bedrooms; this group makes up two-thirds of the housing inventory sold within the past several months.

The city boasts several popular neighborhoods, including The Historic District, The Boulevard, The Elmwood District, The College Hill District, and The Northside.

Sandersville homes for sale are served by the Washington County Public Schools district, which comprises four schools. These include:

Ridge Road Primary School (PK-2)

Washington County Elementary School (3-5)

TJ Elder Middle School (6-8)

Washington County High School (9-12)

The student population of Washington County Public Schools is approximately 3,000. Ensuring school safety is a priority for the district.

Primary and Elementary Schools in Sandersville, Georgia

The youngest children in Sandersville attend Ridge Road Primary School (RRPS) until the end of their 2nd-grade year. This school is located in the northeastern part of the town. RRPS follows the Georgia State Standards for K-12 Education.

The school offers a rigorous academic program that includes a focus on literacy, math, science, and social studies. Ridge Road Primary School has been recognized by the Georgia Department of Education for its academic achievement. The school has also been recognized for its arts program and its commitment to school safety.

From second through fifth grade, students attend Washington County Elementary School (WCES) in the southeast part of Sandersville. WCES offers a variety of extracurricular activities, including sports, clubs, and student government.

The school also has a strong arts program, with offerings in music, theater, and visual arts. Students here make average to above-average academic progress. The strongest academic area across the school population is math.

Middle and High Schools in Sandersville, Georgia

TJ Elder Middle School (TJEMS) serves students in grades 6-8. The school motto is "A Proud Tradition of Excellence," which is clear in its teachers' dedication to serving students as well as the students' high level of academic progress across academic areas.

After middle school, Sandersville students progress to Washington County High School (WCHS). Washington County Public Schools in Sandersville have earned a multitude of distinctions across academics, extracurricular activities, and athletics.

The district offers a robust academic program, including Advanced Placement courses and honors-level college preparatory classes. Students have participated in prestigious programs like the Georgia Governor's Honors Program and have been recognized as National Merit Scholars.

Washington County Public Schools takes pride in its accomplished students who have excelled in various speech and essay contests. The district also boasts a strong arts program, with talented students winning accolades and having their works published.

In terms of extracurricular activities, Washington County Public Schools has achieved notable success. The district has produced winners in SkillsUSA, HOSA - Future Health Professionals, and FBLA competitions, with many students advancing to national levels. The Entrepreneurship program, sponsored by Georgia REAL Student, provides students with valuable skills.

Additionally, Washington County Public Schools has excelled in sports, with numerous regional and state championships in basketball, football, softball, track, and weightlifting. The district takes pride in its famous athletic alumni, including professional athletes who have made their mark in the NBA, NFL, and WNBA.

Higher Education in Sandersville, Georgia

Two notable universities near Sandersville are Georgia Military College in Milledgeville and Mercer University in Macon.

Georgia Military College is a public college with around 2,000 students. It is located approximately 30 miles from Sandersville homes for sale, resulting in a commute time of about 35 minutes. The college offers diverse undergraduate and graduate programs, including fields such as business, engineering, and education.

Mercer University, on the other hand, is a private university with an enrollment of approximately 8,000 students. It is situated around 45 miles from Sandersville homes for sale, requiring a commute time of about 50 minutes. Mercer University provides a wide range of undergraduate and graduate programs, including areas of study such as business, medicine, and law.

Both universities offer excellent educational opportunities within a reasonable commuting distance from Sandersville homes for sale, allowing students in the area to pursue higher education in various disciplines.
